job_title: Senior Research Scientist - Motion Planning, Behavior & Navigation
job_text: ['', 'Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry‚Äôs largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world‚Äôs first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world‚Äôs most-established public robotaxi fleet.', 'About this position:', 'Guide and mentor junior team members to develop a culture of product focused engineering, research, and development.', 'Develop state-of-the-art motion planning algorithms and software to ensure the vehicle navigates safely and smoothly.Interface with perception and prediction components upstream and trajectory optimization and tracking & control components downstreamIntegrate and evaluate combinations of motion planning and prediction algorithmsDevelop a variety of algorithms on planning for autonomous driving, including but not limited to search-based methods, sampling-based methods, optimization-based methods, linear-temporal logic, and decision making under uncertainty.Guide and mentor junior team members to develop a culture of product focused engineering, research, and development.Develop and support motion planning algorithms from ground up all the way to deployment on autonomous vehicles', 'PhD degree in Robotics, EE, CE, Computer Science, or a related field.', 'Motional', 'Integrate and evaluate combinations of motion planning and prediction algorithms', 'We are looking for a Senior Research Scientist with a background and passion in Motion Planning to apply innovative solutions for our autonomous vehicles. Perform ground breaking research and develop optimization algorithms to generate safe, comfortable, and intuitive routes and motions.', '3+ years of C++ software development', 'Develop and support motion planning algorithms from ground up all the way to deployment on autonomous vehicles', 'PhD degree in Robotics, EE, CE, Computer Science, or a related field.Proven impact and expertise in the robotics / autonomous vehicle field.3+ year of research experience in motion planning3+ years of C++ software developmentPast experience owning and leading technical development on features from problem formulation through implementation and deploymentThirst for knowledge and continuous innovation', 'Interface with perception and prediction components upstream and trajectory optimization and tracking & control components downstream', 'Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.', 'Motion Planning', 'Past experience owning and leading technical development on features from problem formulation through implementation and deployment', 'Senior Research Scientist', '3+ year of research experience in motion planning', 'Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group, one of the world‚Äôs largest vehicle manufacturers offering smart mobility solutions, and Aptiv, a global technology leader in advanced safety, electrification, and vehicle connectivity, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.', 'Thirst for knowledge and continuous innovation', 'Develop state-of-the-art motion planning algorithms and software to ensure the vehicle navigates safely and smoothly.', 'Proven impact and expertise in the robotics / autonomous vehicle field.', "What You'll Bring:", "What You'll Do:", 'Develop a variety of algorithms on planning for autonomous driving, including but not limited to search-based methods, sampling-based methods, optimization-based methods, linear-temporal logic, and decision making under uncertainty.']

['', 'Have strong (~2 years) consultatory, clinical and commercial stakeholder management, and leadership skills.', 'The role:', 'You‚Äôll be joining a team of MDs, PhDs, MBAs, and MSc from top tier universities and industries that bring their clinical, technical, and economic experience to bear on some of the toughest targets in healthcare ‚Äì chronic disease.The complex chronic care group within clinical analytics employs cutting-edge ML, signal analysis, and time-series modeling to move the needle on healthcare using claims, commercial pharmacy, and front- end store data. As a lead data scientist supporting a portfolio of chronic disease-oriented internal products, you have strong client-service oriented skills but are a research and development champion.', 'Intelletec has partnered with a leading healthcare provider who is transforming health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive, and patient-focused. Our client‚Äôs mission is to improve health. Due to rapid growth, our client is hiring multiple ML Data Scientists.\xa0', 'The complex chronic care group within clinical analytics employs cutting-edge ML, signal analysis, and time-series modeling to move the needle on healthcare using claims, commercial pharmacy, and front- end store data. As a lead data scientist supporting a portfolio of chronic disease-oriented internal products, you have strong client-service oriented skills but are a research and development champion.', 'MD and/or PhD in a technical field or equivalent practical experience (e.g., PhD in machine learning, computer science, or statistics and modeling heavy engineering field (chemistry and bioengineering)).', 'You‚Äôll be joining a team of MDs, PhDs, MBAs, and MSc from top tier universities and industries that bring their clinical, technical, and economic experience to bear on some of the toughest targets in healthcare ‚Äì chronic disease.', 'Are passionate about helping patients by integrating data science research into application.', 'Have experience (~2 years) leading a team of 2-4 data scientists and are comfortable leading a ‚Äòsquad‚Äô of data scientists working across multiple disease areas.', 'Have 3 or more years of technical data science leadership, focusing on the application of ML to large datasets for healthcare or similar applications.Have strong (~2 years) consultatory, clinical and commercial stakeholder management, and leadership skills.Have experience (~2 years) leading a team of 2-4 data scientists and are comfortable leading a ‚Äòsquad‚Äô of data scientists working across multiple disease areas.Are passionate about helping patients by integrating data science research into application.Are an expert in python and/or R, git, bash, and hive/SQL.', 'Education:', 'MSc with significant experience.MD and/or PhD in a technical field or equivalent practical experience (e.g., PhD in machine learning, computer science, or statistics and modeling heavy engineering field (chemistry and bioengineering)).', 'Have 3 or more years of technical data science leadership, focusing on the application of ML to large datasets for healthcare or similar applications.', 'Are an expert in python and/or R, git, bash, and hive/SQL.', 'Skills:', 'MSc with significant experience.']

', ' Candidates should have good problem solving / communication skills, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment. ', ' The position requires good organizational skills and the ability to work well as part of a team. ', 'Job Facts', ' Candidates must have good theoretical knowledge of analytical and/or organic chemistry. ', 'The Position', ' We seek an outstanding candidate to join Small Molecule Analytical Chemistry efforts within Small Molecule Pharmaceutical Sciences. Responsibilities include designing and performing high-throughput experimentation (HTE) for optimization of reaction conditions on micromole and nanomole scale. Organic chemistry reactions performed would include but not limited to palladium-catalyzed suzuki-miyaura, buchwald-hartwig, photoredox-nickel catalysis, and many others. ', ' The successful candidate will collaborate with chemists in the discovery/medicinal chemistry department to plan and execute screening experiments and to further innovate within the field. ', ' The successful candidate will accomplish our mission through collaboration with our subject matter experts, creative problem-solving, Design of Experiments, and use of state-of-the-art technology including robotic laboratory systems, microscopy, ultra-high-pressure LC, mass spectrometry, chiral separations, supercritical fluid chromatography (SFC) and other analytical instruments. ', 'JOB FUNCTION', ' Some background in lab automation, chromatography (HPLC and data handling/reporting), knowledge of pharmaceutics, solid state characterization or drug discovery are desirable. ', 'Who We Are', ' BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (chemistry or chemical engineering preferred) with 2 ‚Äì 5 years experience in small molecule drug discovery within the pharmaceutical industry.  Candidates must have good theoretical knowledge of analytical and/or organic chemistry.  Some background in lab automation, chromatography (HPLC and data handling/reporting), knowledge of pharmaceutics, solid state characterization or drug discovery are desirable.  Candidates should have good problem solving / communication skills, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.  The position requires good organizational skills and the ability to work well as part of a team. ']

job_title: Senior Research Scientist - Motion Planning, Behavior & Navigation
job_text: ['', 'Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry‚Äôs largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world‚Äôs first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world‚Äôs most-established public robotaxi fleet.', 'About this position:', 'Guide and mentor junior team members to develop a culture of product focused engineering, research, and development.', 'Develop state-of-the-art motion planning algorithms and software to ensure the vehicle navigates safely and smoothly.Interface with perception and prediction components upstream and trajectory optimization and tracking & control components downstreamIntegrate and evaluate combinations of motion planning and prediction algorithmsDevelop a variety of algorithms on planning for autonomous driving, including but not limited to search-based methods, sampling-based methods, optimization-based methods, linear-temporal logic, and decision making under uncertainty.Guide and mentor junior team members to develop a culture of product focused engineering, research, and development.Develop and support motion planning algorithms from ground up all the way to deployment on autonomous vehicles', 'PhD degree in Robotics, EE, CE, Computer Science, or a related field.', 'Motional', 'Integrate and evaluate combinations of motion planning and prediction algorithms', 'We are looking for a Senior Research Scientist with a background and passion in Motion Planning to apply innovative solutions for our autonomous vehicles. Perform ground breaking research and develop optimization algorithms to generate safe, comfortable, and intuitive routes and motions.', '3+ years of C++ software development', 'Develop and support motion planning algorithms from ground up all the way to deployment on autonomous vehicles', 'PhD degree in Robotics, EE, CE, Computer Science, or a related field.Proven impact and expertise in the robotics / autonomous vehicle field.3+ year of research experience in motion planning3+ years of C++ software developmentPast experience owning and leading technical development on features from problem formulation through implementation and deploymentThirst for knowledge and continuous innovation', 'Interface with perception and prediction components upstream and trajectory optimization and tracking & control components downstream', 'Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.', 'Motion Planning', 'Past experience owning and leading technical development on features from problem formulation through implementation and deployment', 'Senior Research Scientist', '3+ year of research experience in motion planning', 'Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group, one of the world‚Äôs largest vehicle manufacturers offering smart mobility solutions, and Aptiv, a global technology leader in advanced safety, electrification, and vehicle connectivity, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.', 'Thirst for knowledge and continuous innovation', 'Develop state-of-the-art motion planning algorithms and software to ensure the vehicle navigates safely and smoothly.', 'Proven impact and expertise in the robotics / autonomous vehicle field.', "What You'll Bring:", "What You'll Do:", 'Develop a variety of algorithms on planning for autonomous driving, including but not limited to search-based methods, sampling-based methods, optimization-based methods, linear-temporal logic, and decision making under uncertainty.']

['', 'Research COMPANY/DIVISION', 'Requirements', 'SCHEDULE', 'JOB TYPE', ' BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (chemistry or chemical engineering preferred) with 2 ‚Äì 5 years experience in small molecule drug discovery within the pharmaceutical industry. ', ' Candidates should have good problem solving / communication skills, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment. ', ' The position requires good organizational skills and the ability to work well as part of a team. ', 'Job Facts', ' Candidates must have good theoretical knowledge of analytical and/or organic chemistry. ', 'The Position', ' We seek an outstanding candidate to join Small Molecule Analytical Chemistry efforts within Small Molecule Pharmaceutical Sciences. Responsibilities include designing and performing high-throughput experimentation (HTE) for optimization of reaction conditions on micromole and nanomole scale. Organic chemistry reactions performed would include but not limited to palladium-catalyzed suzuki-miyaura, buchwald-hartwig, photoredox-nickel catalysis, and many others. ', ' The successful candidate will collaborate with chemists in the discovery/medicinal chemistry department to plan and execute screening experiments and to further innovate within the field. ', ' The successful candidate will accomplish our mission through collaboration with our subject matter experts, creative problem-solving, Design of Experiments, and use of state-of-the-art technology including robotic laboratory systems, microscopy, ultra-high-pressure LC, mass spectrometry, chiral separations, supercritical fluid chromatography (SFC) and other analytical instruments. ', 'JOB FUNCTION', ' Some background in lab automation, chromatography (HPLC and data handling/reporting), knowledge of pharmaceutics, solid state characterization or drug discovery are desirable. ', 'Who We Are', ' BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (chemistry or chemical engineering preferred) with 2 ‚Äì 5 years experience in small molecule drug discovery within the pharmaceutical industry.  Candidates must have good theoretical knowledge of analytical and/or organic chemistry.  Some background in lab automation, chromatography (HPLC and data handling/reporting), knowledge of pharmaceutics, solid state characterization or drug discovery are desirable.  Candidates should have good problem solving / communication skills, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.  The position requires good organizational skills and the ability to work well as part of a team. ']

job_title: Staff Scientist Data Analysis - Clinical Product Support
job_text: ['Pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills', 'Have a deep understanding of product design, development and commercialization for life science and/or genetic analysis platforms, content and associated chemistry. ', 'Demonstrate flexibility, agility and timeliness in managing time and juggling research and development activities.', 'Good technical writing skills, excellent time management skills and ability to work independently required. Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to efficiently evaluate, prioritize and handle multiple and changing programs/projects and priorities.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interpret and summarize scientific results in a clear, concise, accurate manner ', 'Demonstrated success in working with a team of R&D experts to help with customer related troubleshooting for clinical molecular diagnostic products. Have a deep understanding of product design, development and commercialization for life science and/or genetic analysis platforms, content and associated chemistry. Expertise in end to end data analysis with a focus on qPCR multiplex assay developmentWork with company-wide stakeholders, in quality and field support to develop and improve processes for gathering customer feedback, CAPA, complaint handling, and defect tracking and closure. Where relevant, improve current processes or as needed develop new processes. Identify gaps and plan efforts to close these gaps. Demonstrate flexibility, agility and timeliness in managing time and juggling research and development activities.Strong collaborator with ability to motivate and drive product design excellence across internal cross-functional teams in a fast paced environment.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interpret and summarize scientific results in a clear, concise, accurate manner ', 'Expertise in end to end data analysis with a focus on qPCR multiplex assay development', 'Experience with ISO 13485 standards and TrackWise QMS software preferred.', 'Staff Scientist Data Analysis - Clinical Product Support', '*EVRD2020 *GTSDouble', 'Excellent programming skills in C++, Java or Python', 'Strong hands on data analytics, statistical modeling, and classifiers experience', 'Data structures and common methods in data transformation', '2+ years of experience in leading teams in clinical diagnostics5+ years of experience as a data scientistStrong hands on data analytics, statistical modeling, and classifiers experienceData structures and common methods in data transformationPattern recognition and predictive modeling skillsExcellent programming skills in C++, Java or PythonExperience utilizing Matlab, JMP, R, or SPSS3 to 5 years of experience in medical diagnostic product development or on market support.Experience with ISO 13485 standards and TrackWise QMS software preferred.Proven expertise in data analysis and collation of data from diverse sources. Strong experience in qPCR and molecular diagnostics preferred.Must have a good knowledge of the Product Development Process and the inner workings of a large company.', 'Demonstrated success in working with a team of R&D experts to help with customer related troubleshooting for clinical molecular diagnostic products. ', 'Staff Scientist Data Analysis - Clinical Product SupportWhen your part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you‚Äôll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you‚Äôll be supported in achieving your career goals. How will you make an impact? As Staff Scientist in the On-Market Support Team for the Clinical Genetic Testing Solutions Group in Thermo Fisher, you will be responsible for supporting the R&D Troubleshooting and Support function for post market surveillance in the clinical group. You will be contributing and developing processes and mechanisms that facilitate continual improvement of our products and ensure a high level of customer satisfaction for all released products. You will perform data analysis focused on product improvements and troubleshooting to resolve field problems in a timely manner and work with the quality team to ensure good practices are followed for post market surveillance of our products. What will you do? The Staff Scientist, Clinical Product Support, will have leadership responsibility in planning and executing for scientific activities to drive continuous improvements to our portfolio of products that have been launched for infectious disease testing.', '5+ years of experience as a data scientist', 'How will you get here?Education/Experience: ', 'Proven expertise in data analysis and collation of data from diverse sources. Strong experience in qPCR and molecular diagnostics preferred.', 'Good technical writing skills, excellent time management skills and ability to work independently required. Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to efficiently evaluate, prioritize and handle multiple and changing programs/projects and priorities.', '2+ years of experience in leading teams in clinical diagnostics', 'What will you do? ', 'Experience utilizing Matlab, JMP, R, or SPSS3 to 5 years of experience in medical diagnostic product development or on market support.', 'Work with company-wide stakeholders, in quality and field support to develop and improve processes for gathering customer feedback, CAPA, complaint handling, and defect tracking and closure. Where relevant, improve current processes or as needed develop new processes. Identify gaps and plan efforts to close these gaps. ', 'Must have a good knowledge of the Product Development Process and the inner workings of a large company.', 'How will you make an impact? ', 'Strong collaborator with ability to motivate and drive product design excellence across internal cross-functional teams in a fast paced environment.']

You will partner with data science, product, and marketing experts across the company to develop features that promote growth and improve health.', 'Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality software through working in a dynamic, team-focused Agile/Scrum environment', 'You will join the analytics and engineering team to help build the services that power a first-of-its-kind health experience designed in collaboration with Apple. ['', 'Research COMPANY/DIVISION', 'Requirements', 'SCHEDULE', 'JOB TYPE', ' BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (chemistry or chemical engineering preferred) with 2 ‚Äì 5 years experience in small molecule drug discovery within the pharmaceutical industry. ', ' Candidates should have good problem solving / communication skills, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment. ', ' The position requires good organizational skills and the ability to work well as part of a team. ', 'Job Facts', ' Candidates must have good theoretical knowledge of analytical and/or organic chemistry. ', 'The Position', ' We seek an outstanding candidate to join Small Molecule Analytical Chemistry efforts within Small Molecule Pharmaceutical Sciences. Responsibilities include designing and performing high-throughput experimentation (HTE) for optimization of reaction conditions on micromole and nanomole scale. Organic chemistry reactions performed would include but not limited to palladium-catalyzed suzuki-miyaura, buchwald-hartwig, photoredox-nickel catalysis, and many others. ', ' The successful candidate will collaborate with chemists in the discovery/medicinal chemistry department to plan and execute screening experiments and to further innovate within the field. ', ' The successful candidate will accomplish our mission through collaboration with our subject matter experts, creative problem-solving, Design of Experiments, and use of state-of-the-art technology including robotic laboratory systems, microscopy, ultra-high-pressure LC, mass spectrometry, chiral separations, supercritical fluid chromatography (SFC) and other analytical instruments. ', 'JOB FUNCTION', ' Some background in lab automation, chromatography (HPLC and data handling/reporting), knowledge of pharmaceutics, solid state characterization or drug discovery are desirable. ', 'Who We Are', ' BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (chemistry or chemical engineering preferred) with 2 ‚Äì 5 years experience in small molecule drug discovery within the pharmaceutical industry.  Candidates must have good theoretical knowledge of analytical and/or organic chemistry.  Some background in lab automation, chromatography (HPLC and data handling/reporting), knowledge of pharmaceutics, solid state characterization or drug discovery are desirable.  Candidates should have good problem solving / communication skills, and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.  The position requires good organizational skills and the ability to work well as part of a team. ']

[' ', 'Beneficial Skills / Experience:', 'Data Engineer - NY', 'Required Skills / Experience:‚Ä¢ 1+ years of professional data engineering experience‚Ä¢ Proven track record of delivering well written, reliable, supportable and extensible code on-time to production‚Ä¢ Experience with data analysis using languages such as KDB, R, Python/ Pandas ‚Ä¢ Comfortable with mathematical concepts such as: Machine Learning, regression techniques, and statistical analysis ‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English)‚Ä¢ Ability to self-manage and multi-task in a demanding, changing and fast-paced environment‚Ä¢ Proactive and inquisitive nature; keen to collaborate, learn and growBeneficial Skills / Experience:‚Ä¢ Building systems that interface with external vendors/counterparties ‚Ä¢ Architecting and tuning NoSQL data solutions (e.g. MongoDB, Hadoop/HDFS, etc)‚Ä¢ Working with cloud-based infrastructure (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google)', 'Required Skills / Experience:']

['‚Ä¢ Familiar with the Spark ecosystem (e.g. Databricks).', '‚Ä¢ Knowledge of messaging systems, such as Kafka or RabbitMQ.', '‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing. workflows and libraries (scikit-learn, Spark MLlib, TensorFlow/Keras/PyTorch).', '‚Ä¢ Selecting and integrating any Big Data tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities.', '‚Ä¢ Implementing the ETL process and data pipelines.', '‚Ä¢ Experience building cloud data lakes and data warehouses are highly desirable.', 'Running Machine Learning tests and experiments.', '‚Ä¢ Monitoring performance and advising any necessary infrastructure changes.', '‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Big Data querying tools.', '‚Ä¢ Collaborating with Data Scientists to build Machine Learning systems and run experiments.', 'Only W2 (No C2C)', '‚Ä¢ Understanding of Data Catalog, Data Governance, Data Lineage.', 'Summary of Duties & Job Description', 'Skills and Qualifications', '‚Ä¢ Experience building stream-processing systems, using solutions such as Spark-Streaming or Flink.', 'Assignment: Digital Health & Analytics', '‚Ä¢ Knowledge of various ETL techniques and data pipelines.', '‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data engineering.', '‚Ä¢ Knowledge of various databases (RDBMS, NoSQL, HDFS, Cassandra, Redis).', 'We are looking for a Data Engineer to work with our data science teams to collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data. ['', '#DevSciInformatics', 'Effectively communicate complex technical material to scientists, collaborators and senior management.', 'Prior NLP, digital biomarker, imaging analytics, or other machine learning related experience is a huge plus.', 'Competencies And Qualifications', 'Maintain expertise and knowledge of new and emerging technology trends in our industry. As a leader and partner of global efforts, influence and drive problem identification, data analytics strategies and initiatives that have cross-Roche impacts. ['', '\xa0Syntactic and semantic parsing (e.g., top-down, bottom-up, charts, dependency parsing, PCFGs, semantic-driven parsing based on CCGs and the lambda calculus, etc.) ', '\xa0Formal computational semantics ', '\xa0General statistical NLP (sequence labeling algorithms, language models, etc.) ', '\xa0Design and build systems that solve difficult problems in NLP and particularly in QA ', 'We are excited to meet researchers/engineers who want to be part of a team making a big impact and are not afraid to get their hands dirty in data. ', ' ', '\xa0 ', '\xa0Deep learning and distributional semantics, preferably with practical experience using at least one DL framework like TensorFlow or PyTorch ', "\xa0Master's/Ph.D degree, or equivalent industry experience ", "We'll trust you to: ", 'We build systems that enable our clients to ask the Terminal complex questions in natural language. We tackle a range of challenging problems in NLP that require sharp research instincts and solid engineering skills. We are looking for research scientists and software engineers with NLP experience, and specifically with a background and interest in one or more of the following areas:\xa0 ', '\xa0Publish in leading academic venues and represent Bloomberg at industry conferences ', '\xa0General statistical NLP (sequence labeling algorithms, language models, etc.) \xa0Syntactic and semantic parsing (e.g., top-down, bottom-up, charts, dependency parsing, PCFGs, semantic-driven parsing based on CCGs and the lambda calculus, etc.) \xa0Formal computational semantics \xa0Deep learning and distributional semantics, preferably with practical experience using at least one DL framework like TensorFlow or PyTorch \xa0Ontologies and knowledge engineering, particularly as used in knowledge graphs for question answering ', "You'll need to have: ", '\xa0Solid background in natural language processing and/or machine learning (as outlined above) ', '\xa0Ontologies and knowledge engineering, particularly as used in knowledge graphs for question answering ', '\xa0Write, test and maintain production-quality C++ and Python code ', '\xa0Familiarity with C++ is strongly preferred, and functional language programming (ML, Haskell, Scala, etc.) is a big plus.', '\xa0Strong Computer Science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures) ']

', 'Engage and identify potential collaboration with data science teams across DevSci, gRED, pRED, PD and PHC. ['', "We'd love to see:", 'Collaborate closely with product designers on best uses of quantitative DS methods in new & existing products Work with a team of Data Scientists & developers to design, experiment, and evaluate models Actively pursue research in the area of equities and data science Publish such findings, present at conferences, and represent the company in the industry Write, test, and maintain production-quality code implementing these methods ', 'A track record of relevant research- 3+ years experience applying these skills ', "Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì EquitiesNew York, NY - USA\xa0For over 30 years, our clients have relied on our core product to access the data and analytics they need to make informed investment decisions. We absorb billions of data points from hundreds of financial markets every single day. Our teams build applications that fuel the markets by providing intelligent analytics and transparency to level the playing field. We share a real passion for solving today‚Äôs problems by innovating for tomorrow.\xa0We're building a new team, starting small, with researchers and engineers, whose goal is to leverage modern data science to enhance and extend our firm‚Äôs Equities suite of functionality. We will be working closely with product designers to understand how we could improve or optimize their products, including feature engineering, improved relevancy metrics, sentiment extraction, and more. We also intend to actively pursue research in the domain, publish papers, attend conferences, and represent the company in the industry.\xa0We leverage modern open source tools and will also work closely with an existing, dedicated team of infrastructure developers for big-data and distributed analytics. Our ultimate goals are new, novel applications of data science in the equity domain and making such analysis easy and quick for our clients.\xa0We'll trust you to: ", 'Experience in Deep Learning methods and their applications ', 'Collaborate closely with product designers on best uses of quantitative DS methods in new & existing products ', 'A strong quantitative background (Probability Theory, Statistics, Linear Algebra, etc.)- Experience in model evaluation, feature engineering, and time series analytics ', "We'll trust you to:", 'Experience in Deep Learning methods and their applications Experience with distributed computational frameworks (Kubernetes, Spark, Hadoop, etc)- Financial experience/knowledge a plus, but not required- Leadership experience building out teams in comparable areas ', "You'll need to have:", 'Publish such findings, present at conferences, and represent the company in the industry ', 'Write, test, and maintain production-quality code implementing these methods ', 'Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Equities', 'Experience with distributed computational frameworks (Kubernetes, Spark, Hadoop, etc)- Financial experience/knowledge a plus, but not required- Leadership experience building out teams in comparable areas ', 'Actively pursue research in the area of equities and data science ', '3+ years of experience programming in C++, Python, or Java ', 'BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field ', 'Work with a team of Data Scientists & developers to design, experiment, and evaluate models ', 'BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field A strong quantitative background (Probability Theory, Statistics, Linear Algebra, etc.)- Experience in model evaluation, feature engineering, and time series analytics A track record of relevant research- 3+ years experience applying these skills 3+ years of experience programming in C++, Python, or Java ']

['', 'For full consideration, please submit a CV. The posting shall remain open until the position is filled.', 'Apply directly online at http://50.73.55.13/counter.php?id=187782 and follow the on-line instructions to complete the application process.\xa0', 'We are seeking strong software and applied math candidates that can help develop the next generation of finite volume numerical algorithms, which must be both highly accurate and fast on multi-core and GPU architectures. You will join an interdisciplinary team of applied mathematicians and software engineers to develop new algorithms for next-generation high performance computing (HPC) computational science simulations.', 'HPC Numerical Algorithms Postdoctoral Researcher - 91276', 'Berkeley Lab‚Äôs Computational Research (https://crd.lbl.gov/) Division has an opening for a HPC Numerical Algorithms Postdoctoral Researcher to work on high-performance numerical algorithm development. The Applied Numerical Algorithms Group (ANAG) develops advanced numerical algorithms and software for partial differential equations integrated with the application of the software to problems of independent scientific and engineering interest. The primary focus of our work is in the development of high-resolution and adaptive discretizations of partial differential equations in complex geometries, targeting DOE-mission applications including biological systems, electro-chemical and electro-magnetic systems, climate, and fusion energy.', '‚Ä¢ Analyze accuracy and stability of numerical algorithms and linear algebra solvers.', 'What You Will Do:', '‚Ä¢ Contribute in a multidisciplinary team environment which includes mathematicians, software developers, and computational scientists.', '‚Ä¢ General experience in developing and using numerical software for partial differential equations.', 'Equal Employment Opportunity: Berkeley Lab is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or protected veteran status. Berkeley Lab is in compliance with the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision under 41 CFR 60-1.4. Click here (https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters) to view the poster and supplement: "Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law."', '‚Ä¢ Salary will be predetermined based on postdoctoral step rates.', 'Organization:\xa0CR-Computational Research', 'Notes:', '‚Ä¢ Experience developing mathematical and software models for science applications is desired.', '‚Ä¢ Work will be primarily performed at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, 1 Cyclotron Road, Berkeley, CA.', 'How To Apply', '‚Ä¢ This position may be subject to a background check. Any convictions will be evaluated to determine if they directly relate to the responsibilities and requirements of the position. Having a conviction history will not automatically disqualify an applicant from being considered for employment.', 'Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory encourages applications from women, minorities, veterans, and other underrepresented groups presently considering scientific research careers.', 'We value and strive for diversity in backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.', 'What is Required:', '‚Ä¢ This position is represented by a union for collective bargaining purposes.', '‚Ä¢ Understand C++ software design and development for high-performance computer architectures.', '‚Ä¢ Contribute to publications and participate in conferences and meetings.', '‚Ä¢ Understanding of computer systems architecture and their contributions to the overall system performance is also desirable.\xa0', '‚Ä¢ Some experience in C/C++ programming.', '‚Ä¢ This is a full-time 2 year, postdoctoral appointment with the possibility of renewal based upon satisfactory job performance, continuing availability of funds and ongoing operational needs. You must have less than 3 years of paid postdoctoral experience. Salary for Postdoctoral positions depends on years of experience post-degree.', '‚Ä¢ Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or Physical Sciences/Engineering within the last 3 years, with a strong research background in at least some of applied mathematics, computational methods, and scientific computing.']

['', 'What you‚Äôll do', 'You‚Äôll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. You‚Äôll need to care more about analysis being correct then achieving a p-value below 0.05. You‚Äôll collaborate with a group of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds in a process of scientific inquiry. By honestly and openly reviewing others‚Äô work, and having your work reviewed by them, you‚Äôll be a guardian of the research process at Theorem. We‚Äôre using ideas across multiple disciplines: computer science, machine learning, statistics and biostatistics including survival analysis, supervised learning, natural language processing, imbalanced data, feature extraction and selection, and many, many other areas.', 'You must be comfortable writing code. \xa0Nobody will be doing it for you. \xa0The better you are at it, the more efficiently you can explore the model space and find winning ideas. ', 'Knowledge of finance is cool ‚Äì but in no way a requirement. ', 'You‚Äôll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. ', ' ', 'A high level of mathematical and statistical literacy, and an intense interest in applying quantitative analysis to do first class research. ', 'We combine quantitative research, software engineering and rigorous scientific investigation to build credit portfolios that produce strong and consistent yields across business cycles.\xa0\xa0 ', 'Research background devising novel approaches to solving problems and applying them to real world data to achieve robust, repeatable results. ', 'You‚Äôll collaborate with a group of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds in a process of scientific inquiry. ', 'We are based in San Francisco, close to Caltrain and BART. We deeply value intellectual curiosity, creative idea generation, and close collaboration. We offer above market equity and cash compensation, and generous benefits including paternity and maternity leave policy. ', 'You must be comfortable and enjoy working with data. \xa0This is the lifeblood of our business, your hypotheses start there and your testing ends there. ', 'You‚Äôll need to care more about analysis being correct then achieving a p-value below 0.05. ', 'Quantitative Researcher', 'By honestly and openly reviewing others‚Äô work, and having your work reviewed by them, you‚Äôll be a guardian of the research process at Theorem. ', 'A high level of mathematical and statistical literacy, and an intense interest in applying quantitative analysis to do first class research. You should be a good scientist. \xa0You need to know when you have something and when you don‚Äôt, you cannot be fooled by randomness. You must be comfortable and enjoy working with data. \xa0This is the lifeblood of our business, your hypotheses start there and your testing ends there. You should be creative. \xa0You will be coming up with original hypotheses to expand and refine our understanding of the world, and a framework to validate them. You must be comfortable writing code. \xa0Nobody will be doing it for you. \xa0The better you are at it, the more efficiently you can explore the model space and find winning ideas. Research background devising novel approaches to solving problems and applying them to real world data to achieve robust, repeatable results. Knowledge of finance is cool ‚Äì but in no way a requirement. ', 'Quantitative Researcher ', 'We‚Äôre using ideas across multiple disciplines: computer science, machine learning, statistics and biostatistics including survival analysis, supervised learning, natural language processing, imbalanced data, feature extraction and selection, and many, many other areas.', "We are a small team of fewer than 15 with a diversity of ideas and backgrounds applying machine learning, software engineering and rigorous scientific investigation to revamp the lending and securitization space. Every member of the team has a major impact on the company's success, and gets to see their contributions working in the real world. Building good financial forecasting models is extremely challenging from both a technology and research point of view. ", 'What you‚Äôll do ', 'You should be creative. \xa0You will be coming up with original hypotheses to expand and refine our understanding of the world, and a framework to validate them. ', 'You should be a good scientist. \xa0You need to know when you have something and when you don‚Äôt, you cannot be fooled by randomness. ', 'What you bring to the table ', 'What you bring to the table']

['', 'What you‚Äôll do', 'A high level of mathematical and statistical literacy, and an intense interest in applying quantitative analysis to do first class research. You should be a good scientist. \xa0You need to know when you have something and when you don‚Äôt, you cannot be fooled by randomness. You must be comfortable and enjoy working with data. \xa0This is the lifeblood of our business, your hypotheses start there and your testing ends there. You should be creative. \xa0You will be coming up with original hypotheses to expand and refine our understanding of the world, and a framework to validate them. You must be comfortable writing code. \xa0Nobody will be doing it for you. \xa0The better you are at it, the more efficiently you can explore the model space and find winning ideas. Research background devising novel approaches to solving problems and applying them to real world data to achieve robust, repeatable results. Knowledge of finance is cool ‚Äì but in no way a requirement.', 'San Francisco, CA ', 'We‚Äôre using ideas across multiple disciplines: computer science, machine learning, statistics and biostatistics including survival analysis, supervised learning, natural language processing, imbalanced data, feature extraction and selection, and many, many other areas. ', 'Founded in by a Google software engineer and a quant trader, we are backed by some great investors, including Y Combinator and a famous Venture Capital firm. ', 'You must be comfortable writing code. \xa0Nobody will be doing it for you. \xa0The better you are at it, the more efficiently you can explore the model space and find winning ideas. ', "Founded in by a Google software engineer and a quant trader, we are backed by some great investors, including Y Combinator and a famous Venture Capital firm. We are profitable, managing over $800M, including investment from non-profits and university endowments We are a small, passionate, and collaborative team -- fewer than 30 research, engineering and finance and operations professionals with a diversity of backgrounds and ideas Every member of the team has a major impact on the company's success with visible contributions to the business We deeply value intellectual curiosity, creative idea generation, and close collaboration We seek talented individuals who are thoughtful, innovative, tenacious and interested in a mission-focused team environment We share ideas informally at team lunches, academic paper discussions, and through our bi-weekly All-Hands meetings Company events are inclusive and fun, with expeditions to food trucks and Michelin-starred local restaurants, and annual trips to Montana and Stinson Beach featuring hiking and cooking We are located in SoMa in San Francisco, a vigorous 12-minute walk from BART and CalTrain We offer competitive salary and opportunity for equity ownership, generous benefits, and an inclusive and collaborative work environment ", 'You‚Äôll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. ', ' ', 'A high level of mathematical and statistical literacy, and an intense interest in applying quantitative analysis to do first class research. ', 'By honestly and openly reviewing others‚Äô work, and having your work reviewed by them, you‚Äôll be a guardian of the research process at our firm. ', 'We seek talented individuals who are thoughtful, innovative, tenacious and interested in a mission-focused team environment ', 'Research background devising novel approaches to solving problems and applying them to real world data to achieve robust, repeatable results. ', 'An innovative investment fund with over $800 million assets under management, we combine quantitative research, software engineering and rigorous scientific investigation to build credit portfolios that produce strong and consistent yields across business cycles. \xa0 ', 'You‚Äôll collaborate with a group of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds in a process of scientific inquiry. ', 'We are a small, passionate, and collaborative team -- fewer than 30 research, engineering and finance and operations professionals with a diversity of backgrounds and ideas ', 'You must be comfortable and enjoy working with data. \xa0This is the lifeblood of our business, your hypotheses start there and your testing ends there. ', 'You‚Äôll need to care more about analysis being correct then achieving a p-value below 0.05. ', 'We are profitable, managing over $800M, including investment from non-profits and university endowments ', 'Quantitative Researcher', 'What you bring to the table', 'Company events are inclusive and fun, with expeditions to food trucks and Michelin-starred local restaurants, and annual trips to Montana and Stinson Beach featuring hiking and cooking ', 'About us ', 'Quantitative Researcher ', 'About us', 'We offer competitive salary and opportunity for equity ownership, generous benefits, and an inclusive and collaborative work environment ', 'We are located in SoMa in San Francisco, a vigorous 12-minute walk from BART and CalTrain ', 'What you‚Äôll do ', 'You should be creative. \xa0You will be coming up with original hypotheses to expand and refine our understanding of the world, and a framework to validate them. ', 'Knowledge of finance is cool ‚Äì but in no way a requirement.', 'You should be a good scientist. \xa0You need to know when you have something and when you don‚Äôt, you cannot be fooled by randomness. ', 'What you bring to the table ', 'We deeply value intellectual curiosity, creative idea generation, and close collaboration ', "Every member of the team has a major impact on the company's success with visible contributions to the business ", 'We share ideas informally at team lunches, academic paper discussions, and through our bi-weekly All-Hands meetings ', 'You‚Äôll investigate data, construct a hypothesis, and think deeply about the results. \xa0After several iterations, you will discover something new. \xa0Instead of writing a paper, you will actually apply your ideas in the real world and see them working. You‚Äôll need to care more about analysis being correct then achieving a p-value below 0.05. You‚Äôll collaborate with a group of colleagues with a variety of backgrounds in a process of scientific inquiry. By honestly and openly reviewing others‚Äô work, and having your work reviewed by them, you‚Äôll be a guardian of the research process at our firm. We‚Äôre using ideas across multiple disciplines: computer science, machine learning, statistics and biostatistics including survival analysis, supervised learning, natural language processing, imbalanced data, feature extraction and selection, and many, many other areas. ']

job_title: Scientific Researcher / Senior Scientific Researcher, Small Molecule Pharmaceutical Sciences
job_text: ['', 'Research COMPANY/DIVISION', 'SCHEDULE', 'JOB TYPE', 'Strong expertise in chromatography and mass spectrometry (operation and troubleshooting, data analysis and reporting) is required. Experience with lab automation, spectroscopy techniques, data analytics/visualization is a plus, but not required.', 'Candidates should have great learning capability, problem solving skills, communication skills, and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.', 'Job Facts', 'BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (analytical chemistry preferred) with 0-10 years of experience within pharmaceutical industry or analytical instrumentation.', 'Qualifications', 'The Position', 'The position requires critical thinking, organization skills, and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team. ', 'JOB FUNCTION', 'Who We Are', 'BS/MS in a relevant scientific discipline (analytical chemistry preferred) with 0-10 years of experience within pharmaceutical industry or analytical instrumentation.Candidate must have strong knowledge of analytical chemistry. Knowledge of organic chemistry, pharmaceutics, and drug discovery is desirable.Strong expertise in chromatography and mass spectrometry (operation and troubleshooting, data analysis and reporting) is required. Experience with lab automation, spectroscopy techniques, data analytics/visualization is a plus, but not required.Candidates should have great learning capability, problem solving skills, communication skills, and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.The position requires critical thinking, organization skills, and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team. ', 'Candidate must have strong knowledge of analytical chemistry. Knowledge of organic chemistry, pharmaceutics, and drug discovery is desirable.']

job_title: Associated Scientist / Scientist, Oncology Biomarker Development - Cancer Immunotherapy
job_text: ['', 'Research COMPANY/DIVISION', 'SCHEDULE', 'PhD and/or MD with at least 3 years of relevant post-doctoral research experience in immunology, oncology, or cancer immunotherapy', 'Outstanding written and oral communication skills are essential in working in a cross-functional team', 'PhD and/or MD with at least 3 years of relevant post-doctoral research experience in immunology, oncology, or cancer immunotherapyExpertise in human immunology, cancer immunotherapy, single cell genomics, cancer biology, translational research, and strong genomic data analysis skills are highly desirable.Established scientific accomplishment as evidenced by publications in top-tier journals and presentations at top scientific conferences.Outstanding written and oral communication skills are essential in working in a cross-functional teamSuccessful demonstration of initiative, creativity, teamwork, collaboration and technical expertise as an independent and creative scientist.', 'Job Facts', 'Qualifications', 'The Position', ' The Position ', 'JOB FUNCTION', 'Established scientific accomplishment as evidenced by publications in top-tier journals and presentations at top scientific conferences.', 'Expertise in human immunology, cancer immunotherapy, single cell genomics, cancer biology, translational research, and strong genomic data analysis skills are highly desirable.', 'Who We Are', 'JOB TYPE', 'Successful demonstration of initiative, creativity, teamwork, collaboration and technical expertise as an independent and creative scientist.']

job_title: Machine Learning Research Scientist - Pattern Recognition
job_text: ['Publish papers and attend conferences in leading venues representing our Research ', 'A track record of relevant research ', 'Machine Learning Research Scientist - Pattern Recognition\xa0 ', 'Drive projects as the principle point-of-contact, with the ability to determine and elaborate on suitable metrics as well as methods ', ' Drive projects as the principle point-of-contact, with the ability to determine and elaborate on suitable metrics as well as methods  Write, test, and maintain production-quality code (mainly C++)  Publish papers and attend conferences in leading venues representing our Research  ', 'Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, CNTK, etc.) is helpful ', ' ', 'Solid background in machine learning and/or statistics, publication history ', ' Strong computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures)  A track record of relevant research  Solid background in machine learning and/or statistics, publication history  Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, CNTK, etc.) is helpful  Experience with NLP is also very useful', 'Feature engineering ', 'State of the art deep learning (e.g., hyper-parameter tuning, sequence-to-sequence methods, word/entity embeddings, CNNs, etc.) ', 'Big data experience ', 'Machine Learning Research Scientist - Pattern Recognition\xa0', "We'll trust you to: ", 'Experience with NLP is also very useful', "We'll trust you to:", "You'll need to have:", 'Familiarly with time series analytics ', "With the ever-increasing amount of data being generated, our clients need ever more sophisticated ways of extracting signal from noise. The Pattern Recognition team in the Machine Learning group is responsible for building a wide variety of analytics and recommendation systems to surface insights (e.g., identify market moving news stories, create new events that are relevant to users, provide personalized recommendations of events to users, etc.) to increase our client's productivity. ", 'We are looking for research scientists with experience running a machine learning project from inception to completion, and specifically with a background and interest in one or more of the following areas: ', "You'll need to have: ", 'Strong computer science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures) ', 'Model evaluation ', 'Write, test, and maintain production-quality code (mainly C++) ', 'We ingests more than 1.5 million news stories per day from more than 120,000 different sources to help our clients stay in the know. This data would be unmanageable without our help. News stories move markets. We build machines that understand them. ', ' State of the art deep learning (e.g., hyper-parameter tuning, sequence-to-sequence methods, word/entity embeddings, CNNs, etc.)  Model evaluation  Feature engineering  Big data experience  Familiarly with time series analytics  ']

job_title: Senior Scientific Researcher, Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics
job_text: ['', 'Research COMPANY/DIVISION', ' Applications of software involving metabolism prediction, molecular modeling, or dataset management is a plus ', ' B.A. or M.S. degree in organic chemistry, pharmaceutical science, analytical, medicinal chemistry, or other relevant discipline with a strong chemistry and experimental metabolism background  3+ years previous experience working with drug metabolism and using a high-resolution LC-MS is required  Working knowledge of drug metabolizing enzymes, reaction mechanisms, bioactivation and bioanalytical techniques such as chromatographic separation and LC-MS/MS structure analysis of small molecules and/or peptides (DNA/RNA is a plus)  Ability to work independently and as part of a team, along with excellent communication skills  Applications of software involving metabolism prediction, molecular modeling, or dataset management is a plus ', 'JOB FUNCTION', 'Who We Are', ' Characterize soft spots, describe drug metabolism pathways, and identify metabolizing enzymes involved in both in vitro and in vivo studies ', 'Requirements', ' Ability to work independently and as part of a team, along with excellent communication skills ', ' 3+ years previous experience working with drug metabolism and using a high-resolution LC-MS is required ', 'The Position', ' Solid analytical knowledge using and developing LC-MS methods. This includes maintaining high-resolution LC-MS, sample preparation, and analysis  Design, perform, and interpret drug metabolism studies with a focus on metabolite identification in drug discovery  Characterize soft spots, describe drug metabolism pathways, and identify metabolizing enzymes involved in both in vitro and in vivo studies  Leverage In silico tools to complement metabolism data ', 'SCHEDULE', ' Working knowledge of drug metabolizing enzymes, reaction mechanisms, bioactivation and bioanalytical techniques such as chromatographic separation and LC-MS/MS structure analysis of small molecules and/or peptides (DNA/RNA is a plus) ', ' Leverage In silico tools to complement metabolism data ', 'Job Facts', ' Design, perform, and interpret drug metabolism studies with a focus on metabolite identification in drug discovery ', 'JOB TYPE', 'Primary Responsibilities Include', ' B.A. or M.S. degree in organic chemistry, pharmaceutical science, analytical, medicinal chemistry, or other relevant discipline with a strong chemistry and experimental metabolism background ', ' Solid analytical knowledge using and developing LC-MS methods. This includes maintaining high-resolution LC-MS, sample preparation, and analysis ']

C++14/17 is beneficial ', 'Meditation', 'Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ', 'NEW YORK ', 'Power stretching and floatation therapy ', ' ', 'Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome ', 'Ping pong and poker games Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes Power stretching and floatation therapy Unlimited office snacks Free breakfast, lunch, and dinner Gym Membership Meditation', 'Ping pong and poker games ', 'Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems ', 'As a Data Engineer at our firm, you will play a critical role in managing vast amounts of data that drive our automated trading platform. ', 'Team outings, such as go-karting and cooking classes ', 'Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with machine learning researchers, traders, and other engineers ', 'Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue ', 'You can expect: ', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field from a top tier university 3+ years' experience in data engineering or related software engineering Demonstrable experience with Python and SQL.  C++14/17 is beneficial Experience with columnar time series databases such as KDB would be welcome Experience with distributed systems (Condor, Hadoop, Spark) in a Linux environment Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and database schema design Ability to troubleshoot any performance, system, or data-related issue Previous experience in the design, optimization, and support of big-data ecosystems Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with machine learning researchers, traders, and other engineers Have an interest and enthusiasm for learning about financial markets (previous experience not required) ", "The nature of the problems we work on are really challenging, hence we hire some of the world's top talent to develop novel AI methods and trading strategies. job_title: Senior Scientific Researcher, Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics
job_text: ['', 'Research COMPANY/DIVISION', ' Applications of software involving metabolism prediction, molecular modeling, or dataset management is a plus ', ' B.A. or M.S. degree in organic chemistry, pharmaceutical science, analytical, medicinal chemistry, or other relevant discipline with a strong chemistry and experimental metabolism background  3+ years previous experience working with drug metabolism and using a high-resolution LC-MS is required  Working knowledge of drug metabolizing enzymes, reaction mechanisms, bioactivation and bioanalytical techniques such as chromatographic separation and LC-MS/MS structure analysis of small molecules and/or peptides (DNA/RNA is a plus)  Ability to work independently and as part of a team, along with excellent communication skills  Applications of software involving metabolism prediction, molecular modeling, or dataset management is a plus ', 'JOB FUNCTION', 'Who We Are', ' Characterize soft spots, describe drug metabolism pathways, and identify metabolizing enzymes involved in both in vitro and in vivo studies ', 'Requirements', ' Ability to work independently and as part of a team, along with excellent communication skills ', ' 3+ years previous experience working with drug metabolism and using a high-resolution LC-MS is required ', 'The Position', ' Solid analytical knowledge using and developing LC-MS methods. This includes maintaining high-resolution LC-MS, sample preparation, and analysis  Design, perform, and interpret drug metabolism studies with a focus on metabolite identification in drug discovery  Characterize soft spots, describe drug metabolism pathways, and identify metabolizing enzymes involved in both in vitro and in vivo studies  Leverage In silico tools to complement metabolism data ', 'SCHEDULE', ' Working knowledge of drug metabolizing enzymes, reaction mechanisms, bioactivation and bioanalytical techniques such as chromatographic separation and LC-MS/MS structure analysis of small molecules and/or peptides (DNA/RNA is a plus) ', ' Leverage In silico tools to complement metabolism data ', 'Job Facts', ' Design, perform, and interpret drug metabolism studies with a focus on metabolite identification in drug discovery ', 'JOB TYPE', 'Primary Responsibilities Include', ' B.A. or M.S. degree in organic chemistry, pharmaceutical science, analytical, medicinal chemistry, or other relevant discipline with a strong chemistry and experimental metabolism background ', ' Solid analytical knowledge using and developing LC-MS methods. This includes maintaining high-resolution LC-MS, sample preparation, and analysis ']

['', 'Partner with data scientists to understand, implement, refine and design machine learning and other algorithms.', 'Work cross functionally with product managers, data scientists and product engineers, and communicate results to peers and leaders.', 'Experience with GPU acceleration (i.e. CUDA and cuDNN)', 'Explore new technology shifts in order to determine how they might connect with the customer benefits we wish to deliver.', 'Knowledge of data query and data processing tools (i.e. SQL)', 'Work with data scientists to create and refine features from the underlying data and build pipelines to train and deploy models.', 'How You Will Lead', 'BS, MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.6+ years of experience Knowledgeable with Data Science tools and frameworks (i.e. Python, Scikit, NLTK, Numpy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Keras, R, Spark). Basic knowledge of machine learning techniques (i.e. classification, regression, and clustering).Understand machine learning principles (training, validation, etc.)Knowledge of data query and data processing tools (i.e. SQL)Computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, performance complexity, and implications of computer architecture on software performance (e.g., I/O and memory tuning).Software engineering fundamentals: version control systems (i.e. Git, Github) and workflows, and ability to write production-ready code.Experience deploying highly scalable software supporting millions or more usersExperience with GPU acceleration (i.e. CUDA and cuDNN)Experience with integrating applications and platforms with cloud technologies (i.e. AWS and GCP)Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to conduct meetings and make professional presentations, and to explain complex concepts and technical material to non-technical users', 'Computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, performance complexity, and implications of computer architecture on software performance (e.g., I/O and memory tuning).', 'Experience with integrating applications and platforms with cloud technologies (i.e. AWS and GCP)', 'Software engineering fundamentals: version control systems (i.e. Git, Github) and workflows, and ability to write production-ready code.', 'Discover data sources, get access to them, import them, clean them up, and make them ‚Äúmachine learning ready‚Äù.Work with data scientists to create and refine features from the underlying data and build pipelines to train and deploy models.Partner with data scientists to understand, implement, refine and design machine learning and other algorithms.Run regular A/B tests, gather data, perform statistical analysis, draw conclusions on the impact of your models.Work cross functionally with product managers, data scientists and product engineers, and communicate results to peers and leaders.Explore new technology shifts in order to determine how they might connect with the customer benefits we wish to deliver.', 'Basic knowledge of machine learning techniques (i.e. classification, regression, and clustering).', 'Knowledgeable with Data Science tools and frameworks (i.e. Python, Scikit, NLTK, Numpy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Keras, R, Spark). ', 'Understand machine learning principles (training, validation, etc.)', 'BS, MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.', "What You'll Bring", 'Discover data sources, get access to them, import them, clean them up, and make them ‚Äúmachine learning ready‚Äù.', 'Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to conduct meetings and make professional presentations, and to explain complex concepts and technical material to non-technical users', '6+ years of experience ', 'Run regular A/B tests, gather data, perform statistical analysis, draw conclusions on the impact of your models.', 'Overview', 'Experience deploying highly scalable software supporting millions or more users']

['Proficiency with RDBMS, NoSQL, distributed compute platforms such as Spark, Dask or Hadoop ', 'Enterprise Data Engineer', 'Key Responsibilities ', '\xa0 ', 'Strong business acumen with prior experience in investment research or direct exposure to product or data science teams AND passionate about using data for investment decisions', 'Enterprise Data Engineer ', 'Enterprise Data Engineers build pipelines that support datasets used by all investment teams and strategies across the firm. They manage the firm‚Äôs most critical data sets and focus on applying software development best practices to solve complex data challenges. The expectation is that the data engineer has sound programming skills, strong business acumen, and a strong interest in finance. ', 'Prior work developing BI tooling and/or application development for data analytics ', 'A passion for working with data and developing software to address data processing challenges Proficiency with Python, C++, Java or equivalent Proficiency with RDBMS, NoSQL, distributed compute platforms such as Spark, Dask or Hadoop Prior experience building data pipelines from structured or unstructured data preferably including web crawlers Prior work developing BI tooling and/or application development for data analytics Advanced technical communication skills Working knowledge of statistics, predictive analytics or machine learning techniques Strong business acumen with prior experience in investment research or direct exposure to product or data science teams AND passionate about using data for investment decisions', 'Required Skills ', 'Required Skills', 'Advanced technical communication skills ', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Develop solutions that enable internal analysts to efficiently extract insights from data. This includes owning the ingestion (web scrapes, S3/FTP sync, bespoke processes), transformations (Python, Perl) and interface (API, schema design, events, etc.) Build tooling and automation around data pipelines that improve the efficiency, quality and resiliency of our data platform Partner with internal analysts, quants and data scientists to design, develop, test and deploy solutions that answer fundamental questions about financial markets. Take on an entrepreneurial mentality by building and selling your own ideas. We work in an evolving space and we expect you to help design our evolution by challenging the status quo and independently identifying opportunities to improve the entire data organization. ', 'New York, NY', 'Build tooling and automation around data pipelines that improve the efficiency, quality and resiliency of our data platform ', 'Take on an entrepreneurial mentality by building and selling your own ideas. We work in an evolving space and we expect you to help design our evolution by challenging the status quo and independently identifying opportunities to improve the entire data organization. ', 'Proficiency with Python, C++, Java or equivalent ', 'Partner with internal analysts, quants and data scientists to design, develop, test and deploy solutions that answer fundamental questions about financial markets. ', 'A passion for working with data and developing software to address data processing challenges ', 'New York, NY ', 'Working knowledge of statistics, predictive analytics or machine learning techniques ', 'Prior experience building data pipelines from structured or unstructured data preferably including web crawlers ', 'Data Engineers are the architects of the next generation platforms that control how the firm interacts with and consumes information. They own the entire data pipeline starting with how we ingest data from the outside world, through the transformation of data into actionable insights, and finally the interfaces and APIs that our analysts and portfolio managers use to monetize that information. Throughout that process our data engineers work closely with investment professionals and researchers to design systems that answer some of the most challenging questions in the hedge fund industry. ', 'Develop solutions that enable internal analysts to efficiently extract insights from data. This includes owning the ingestion (web scrapes, S3/FTP sync, bespoke processes), transformations (Python, Perl) and interface (API, schema design, events, etc.) ']

['', 'Senior Data Engineer', "What you'll do:", 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)', 'Deep knowledge of at least one programming language ecosystem (e.g. Python, Scala, Go) ', "At our company, we‚Äôre building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our company is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Senior Data EngineerCommercial Launchpad helps push the Commercial Bank forward by incubating new ideas and accelerating strategic initiatives. We are a diverse, balanced and fearless team of designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers & strategists ‚Äî working together to solve complex problems across the Commercial Bank. We move fast, we have the freedom to take risks, both in the ways we approach problems and the tools we use.Keep reading if:You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries, are comfortable with challenging the status-quo, and thrive in ambiguity.You LOVE technology and learning new things.What we‚Äôre looking for:Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.Demonstrated experience in the open source, big data ecosystem.What you'll do:As the data engineering technical lead within Launchpad, you‚Äôll be working collaboratively with some of our brightest engineering talent to solve challenging, high impact business problems using data. You will be evaluating, installing, configuring, and deploying software; you will be writing code and use thoughtful engineering practices to test it, deploy it, and run it. We are a part of a larger organization, so we will rely on your ability to get things done through others.All of our infrastructure runs on AWS. Currently we use Airflow, PySpark, NiFi, Kafka, Flink for stream processing. We store data in Parquet and use databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redshift and Snowflake. We do analytics using H2O, Spark and MLlib, Databricks/EMR, TensorFlow. We build awesome products for our users that use this data. We write microservices in Go and Node.js, orchestrated by Kubernetes, with user experiences written in React and TypeScript. Your hands-on expertise in at least some of these tools will be valuable, as well as your track record of providing effective technical guidance.Basic QualificationsAt least 3 years of experience in software engineering inclusive of source control, agile practices, testing, CI/CD and design principlesAt least 3 years data engineering experience that includes Ingestion, Transformation, Storage, Query, or Analytics open source toolsPreferred Qualifications", 'Keep reading if:', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' ', 'What we‚Äôre looking for:', 'Basic Qualifications', 'Practical experience with data modeling (e.g. dimensional modeling, temporal modeling, OLAP)']

assist in writing documents for regulatory filings', 'JOB FUNCTION', 'Strong interpersonal skills.', 'Who We Are', 'A BA, BS or MS degree in biology, chemistry or other relevant fields with at least 2 years of experience and good understanding of PK / ADME concepts.', 'A BA, BS or MS degree in biology, chemistry or other relevant fields with at least 2 years of experience and good understanding of PK / ADME concepts.Excellent organizational skills, oral/written communication skills and flexibility are essential.Familiarity with routine in vitro DMPK methods and data interpretation.Strong interpersonal skills.', 'Participate and contribute to discovery/development project teams', 'The Position', 'Familiarity with PBPK modeling software SimCYP and/or Gastroplus', 'Familiarity with routine in vitro DMPK methods and data interpretation.', 'SCHEDULE', '5-10years of pharmaceutical industry experience', 'Interact with CROs in setting up and managing in vivo studies', 'Job Facts', 'Coordinate and analyze PK/ADME studies supporting development projects; assist in writing documents for regulatory filings', '5-10years of pharmaceutical industry experienceTrack record of supporting projects and interdisciplinary interactionsAbility to use Phoenix WinNONLIN and other data management softwareKnowledge of drug metabolism, biotransformation, transport and ability to use in silico ADME toolsFamiliarity with PBPK modeling software SimCYP and/or Gastroplus', 'JOB TYPE', 'Designing, scheduling and coordination of in vivo pharmacokinetic studies as well as pharmacokinetic data analysis and interpretation', 'Knowledge of drug metabolism, biotransformation, transport and ability to use in silico ADME tools', 'Required Qualifications', 'Track record of supporting projects and interdisciplinary interactions', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Excellent organizational skills, oral/written communication skills and flexibility are essential.']
